name: Classical Studies
descriptions: The Classical Studies minor offers the chance to engage with the highly influential history and cultures of the ancient Greco-Roman world. The program explores all facets of the ancient world, including language, religion, philosophy, and literature.

Students examine the thoughts, ideas, histories, and stories that formed the backbone of modern society, developing a deep understanding of contemporary systems and forward-thinking perspectives applicable to any career field.

courses: 18 hours selected from at least three areas, with a minimum of 6 hours of upper-division courses

features: Study abroad in Greece or Italy may qualify for program credit with director approval
Courses drawn from Religion, Philosophy, History, and English departments
